result.execSummary:
The defendant Scotty L. Lay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Counterfeit Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay extradition costs totaling $385.53.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Consecutive to any other sentence.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes:

Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.

Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Shawno Connell, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.  Release to be effectuated within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.  (copy sent to parties and faxed to DOC)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 050316 sentencing after revocation hearing paid by county $32.00.
Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge
8 yrs WSP; 3 yrs Initial followed by 5 yrs ES.  Eligible for CIP & SAP

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Cassi Baumgardner.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP consecutive to any other sentence; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 53 days.  DE is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Court costs ordered and DNA surcharge plus costs ordered if not already done.  Appeal Rights given.
Atty Baumgardner appointed and unavailable on 5/5, but is available on 5/3 at 2:00 PM so hearing moved up to that date.

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 4/6/16; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.
At the request of probation agent Michelle Pounders, SEHR set for 5/5/16 at 9:00.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extradition Costs Determined in the amount of $385.53.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Credit for 53 days if revoked.  Fined $500 plus costs & surcharges including Extradition Costs in the amount of $385.53.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: File sent to Br 3 for subst.
This event is needed in order to open and close this case.
Substitution of Br 3 filed. Tab pulled for Br 8.  kmk

114pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Bill Michel.  Clerk: LE  Substitution of Br 3 filed. Tab pulled for Br 8.  Referred to Br. 8 for further disposition on 7/23/15 @ 9am (FPT).  Information filed.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Bond continued.  kmk

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Bill Michel. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Information filed. Atty. Michel requests adjournment for arraignment. Arraignment today at 1:00pm. Bond continued.

123 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  6/11/15 @ 945 a.m.  Warrant vacated.   $10,000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(2)(a)  Deliver a Counterfeit Schedule I or II Naracotic Drug, Repeater, Second & Subs Offense.
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.
and witness list filed by the State
